name: Marcus Johnson
situation: 18-year-old facing homelessness while finishing senior year of high school.
story:
Hey, I'm Marcus. I'm 18 and currently living out of my car while trying to finish my last semester of high school. A lot of people have been following my TikTok where I share what daily life is really like when you're young and unhoused.

I aged out of foster care six months ago, and things got really tough really fast. I'm working part-time at a fast food place, but it's not enough to cover rent in this city. I've been couch surfing when I can, but mostly I sleep in my 2008 Honda Civic in different parking lots.

I'm determined to graduate this spring - I have a 3.4 GPA and I've been accepted to community college. But right now I'm struggling to afford gas to get to school and work, food, and basic hygiene supplies so I can stay clean for my job. I also need to save for first and last month's rent to get into a room somewhere.

I share my story not for pity, but because I know I'm not alone. There are thousands of young people like me just trying to survive and build a better future. Any support helps me get one step closer to stability.

needs.title: Housing Deposit
needs.description: First and last month's rent plus security deposit for a room.

needs.title: Food & Essentials
needs.description: Money for groceries, hygiene products, and basic necessities.

needs.title: Transportation
needs.description: Gas money and car maintenance to get to school and work.

needs.title: School Supplies
needs.description: Materials needed to finish senior year and start community college.
